Definition: You will be given two sentences. One of them is a paraphrase of the original sentence, with changes in one or more aspects. Your task is to identify the type of change(s) between the two sentences. The types of changes are explained below: Tense: The verbs in the sentence are changed in tense. Number: Plural nouns, verbs and pronouns are changed into single ones or the other way around. Voice: If the verbs are in active voice, they're changed to passive or the other way around. Adverb: The paraphrase has one adverb or more than the original sentence. Gender: The paraphrase differs from the original sentence in the gender of the names and pronouns. Synonym: Some words or phrases of the original sentence are replaced with synonym words or phrases. Changes in the names of people are also considered a synonym change. Classify your answers into Tense, Number, Voice, Adverb, Gender, and Synonym.

Positive Examples.input: original sentence: Lily spoke to Donna , breaking her silence . paraphrase: Lily is speaking to Donna , breaking her silence .
Positive Examples.explanation: The verbs in this example are changed from past tense to present tense.

Positive Examples.input: original sentence: I'm sure that my map will show this building ; it is very good . paraphrase: I'm sure that my maps will show these buildings ; they are very good .
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example, map and building and their pronouns has been changed. So, the output should be Number.

Positive Examples.input: original sentence: Jim signaled the barman and gestured toward his bathroom key . paraphrase: Jim dreamily signaled the barman and vaguely gestured toward his bathroom key .
Positive Examples.explanation: In this example the adverbs "vaguely" and "dreamily" are added to the original sentence.

Negative Examples.input: original sentence: The dog chased the cat , which ran up a tree . It waited at the bottom . paraphrase: The dog is chasing the cat , which is running up a tree . It is waiting at the bottom .
Negative Examples.explanation: The change in the original sentence is to tense, as the past tense verbs are changed to present tense ones. "Voice" is not a correct answer here.

Negative Examples.input: original sentence: John was doing research in the library when he heard a man humming and whistling . He was very annoyed . paraphrase: John and Steve were doing research in the library when they heard men humming and whistling . They were very annoyed .
Negative Examples.explanation: You should only output the title of the change, and nothing more.
